bwwExcerpt: The "Baby" players make the most of their threadbare parts. Leavel elevates the enterprise with pitch-perfect singing, acting and bouffant, her Florence blowzy and vulnerable.Â Near the end, Greenberg concedes that the Shirelles sound needs updating. For a fleeting instant, the first major girl group of the rock era and the show about them seem to be going somewhere new.
